Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Tranexamic Acid for Preventing Scar Tissue in Craniectomy

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 20 male Wistar rats

Participants.evidence: 20 male Wistar rats, approximately 12 months old, undergoing bilateral frontoparietal craniectomy

Intervention.evidence: a control group (n=10) receiving saline-soaked cotton pads and a tranexamic acid group (n=10) receiving cotton pads soaked with 30 mg/kg tranexamic acid

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the efficacy of tranexamic acid in preventing scar tissue formation in the craniectomy area in rats.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was dura mater thickness, measured 30 days post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: The rats were randomly assigned to two groups

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to the pathologist assessing outcomes.

Number_Analysed.evidence: a control group (n=10) receiving saline-soaked cotton pads and a tranexamic acid group (n=10)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The tranexamic acid group exhibited significantly thinner dura mater compared to the control group (p=0.001).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
